Event: Shiloh Baptist Church stampede - Birmingham, Alabama, United States
Event description: Crush following a false fire alarm at a convention featuring Booker T. Washington.

Event: Iroquois Theatre fire - Chicago, United States
Event description: Most deaths caused by crush asphyxiation in the rush to escape.

Event: Barnsley Public Hall disaster - Barnsley, England, United Kingdom
Event description: Children attempting to view a show were crushed on the stairs when the hall became overcrowded, resulting in the deaths of 16 children.

Event: Collinwood school fire - Collinwood, Ohio, United States
Event description: One rescue worker, two teachers, and 172 children between the ages of five and fifteen were killed. Most of the children were killed in a stairwell when some were trying to escape down the stairs while others, who had found escape impossible that way, were trying to flee up the stairs.

Event: Italian Hall disaster - Calumet, Michigan, United States
Event description: The event is considered the source for the often-cited legal limit of protected speech, i.e., that one may not falsely shout "Fire!" in a crowded theater.

Following a bomb attack during World War I, Parisians tried to enter the Bolivar metro station, but the gates down the stairs only opened to the outside. The first rows of the crowd were crushed or suffocated by those behind them.

Event: Glen Cinema disaster - Paisley, Scotland, United Kingdom
Event description: Caused by a smoking film canister. The resulting panic and crush initially killed 69 children and injured 40; two others later succumbed.

Event: Kyoto Railroad Station tragedy - Kyoto, Japan
Event description: A crowd of about 10,000 saying farewell to 750 recruits of the Imperial Japanese Navy collapsed at the bottom of a stairway from a viaduct leading over the tracks down to the platform. The number far exceeded the station's capacity.

Thousands rushed to the Shiba Ti Tunnel bomb shelter during the Japanese Bombing of Chongqing in the Second Sino-Japanese War and were locked from the outside. Crowding and lack of oxygen caused a stampede to get out, crushing many.

Crowd crush during an attack by the RAF Bomber Command in World War II as they made their way into Galleria delle Grazie, a railway tunnel used as an air-raid shelter. Rushing down the 150 steps leading underground into the shelter, people fell on top of one another.

Event: Bethnal Green tube station disaster - London, United Kingdom
Event description: People were entering the station during an air-raid alert during World War II, and a woman holding a child lost her footing and fell down the stairs, leading to the crowd falling around her in a crush.

Event: Hartford circus fire - Hartford, Connecticut, United States
Event description: A fire broke out at a performance of the Ringling Brothers and Barnum & Bailey Circus. Many died after being trampled by other spectators, with some asphyxiating underneath the piles of people who fell over each other. Most of the dead were found in piles, some three bodies deep, at the most congested exits. A small number of people were found alive at the bottoms of these piles, protected by the bodies on top of them when the burning big top ultimately fell down.

Event: Burnden Park disaster - Bolton, England, United Kingdom
Event description: At an FA Cup Quarter-final between Bolton Wanderers and Stoke City, the collapse of two crash barriers in an overcrowded stand led to the crowd falling forward upon each other.

Event: Santa Teresa Church tragedy [es] - Caracas, Venezuela
Event description: Occurred when someone shouted "Fire!" in the Basilica of St. Teresa. 40 people were arrested in connection with the crush. Two men who were arrested on the day of the crush were released. The panic started when an elderly devotee brushed against the veil which was holding candles in the head, making a small fire that alarmed those responsible for the panic.

Event: Stalin funeral crush - Moscow, Soviet Union
Event description: A crush in Trubnaya Square during the state funeral of Joseph Stalin.

Event: 1954 Prayag Kumbh Mela stampede - Allahabad, India
Event description: A surging crowd broke through the barriers separating them from a procession of sadhus and holy men of various akharas, resulting in a crush.
New Year panic and crush at the Yahiko Shinto shrine.

Event: Busan Stadium crush - Busan, South Korea
Event description: Heavy rain forced spectators to rush towards the upper sections of the municipal stadium, leading to the crush.

Event: Seoul Station crush - Seoul, South Korea
Event description: Occurred two days before the Lunar New Year when many people were returning to their hometowns. About 3,900 people, more than three times the average crowd, flocked to the ticket gate, where 200 tickets were sold for a train with a capacity of 80 people.

In the worst disaster in association football history, fans disputing a referee's decision during a match between Peru and Argentina began a pitch invasion and police fired tear gas canisters into one of the grandstands to prevent more fans from invading the field, causing panic so that departing spectators moved down the enclosed stairways, pressing those in the lead against solid corrugated steel shutters at the bottom of tunnels, which were closed. The shutters finally burst outward from pressure of the crush of bodies inside. All of those that died were killed in the jammed stairwells, most from internal haemorrhaging by crushing pressure, or by asphyxia. An additional 500 people were injured, many critically.

Fans were caught in a crush at the bottom of the stairs leaving through Gate 12 (Puerta 12 in Spanish) of El Monumental Stadium after a derby between River Plate and Boca Juniors. The exact cause for this crush is not certain, though rival fans might have been throwing burning paper, causing a panic. Other accounts say that the gate was closed, either by police or by other fans, intentionally or unintentionally. Still others argue that it was a simple matter of too many fans going through a gate that was narrower than the staircase leading to it. The disaster remains the deadliest sports-related event in Argentine history.

Stairway barriers collapsed after someone fell as fans were leaving the Ibrox Stadium following a match between Rangers and Celtic, leading to a crush. The tragedy included many children who died, and most of the deaths were caused by compressive asphyxia, with bodies being stacked up to six feet deep in the area. More than 200 others were injured.
Crush after a friendly hockey match at the Sokolniki Sports Palace between the Soviet junior national team and the Canadian junior team Barrie Co-op. 25 others were wounded .

Event: The Who concert disaster - Cincinnati, Ohio, United States
Event description: Crush at a concert by The Who at the Riverfront Coliseum. The incident led to a reduced use of festival seating at U.S. venues.
On the 10th day of Pope John Paul II's visit to Brazil, in an effort to get good seats, the crowd at the Castelao Stadium broke down an unguarded gate and trampled those killed in the rush.

While some fans were exiting the stadium after a match between Olympiacos and AEK Athens, some lost their balance and fell on the last steps; soon dozens fell onto each other and were stepped over by a horde of unsuspecting fans who kept coming. 19 people died at the scene, while two more died of their wounds in hospital. At least 55 were wounded.

A crush began at a UEFA Cup match between FC Spartak Moscow and HFC Haarlem at Luzhniki Stadium after a person fell and a dense moving crowd, their direction limited by metal banisters, pushed over the fallen, crushing them. Others stumbled over the bodies in a domino effect creating a large chain-reaction pile-up of people.

Event: Khavarovsk Stadium disaster [ru] - Khabarovsk, Soviet Union
Event description: The crush occurred after a ball hockey match at the Lenin Stadium (Khabarovsk). 19 people died, 49 were wounded .

A crush occurred by a collapsing wall when fans escaping a confrontation between competing fan groups were pressed against it in the stadium before the start of the 1985 European Cup Final between Liverpool and Juventus. 600 were injured, and the disaster was later described as "the darkest hour in the history of the UEFA competitions".

Event: Unnamed - Shanyang County, Shaanxi Province, China
Event description: At around 7 a.m., children rushed out of their classrooms at Chengguan Primary School after a bell called all pupils to attend a weekly school assembly on the sports field. One metal door at one end of the building was locked, causing the children from all 18 classes to rush down an unlighted stairwell to the only other exit, and some in the front fell over.

Football fans at Dasarath Rangasala Stadium attending a Tribhuvan Challenge Shield match between Janakpur Cigarette Factory and Bangladeshi side Liberation Army surged towards the only cover during a hailstorm. The crowd was beaten back by police, but when they returned to the south terrace, a crush developed in a tunnel exit through the terrace and could not escape because the stadium doors were locked, causing a fatal crush at the front of the crowd. 100 more were injured.

In one of the world's worst football disasters, 766 people others were injured at Hillsborough Stadium during an FA Cup match between Liverpool and Nottingham Forest. The intensity of the crush broke the barriers on the terraces, while those trapped were packed so tightly in the pens that many victims died of compressive asphyxia while still standing. The 1990 official inquiry concluded that the primary cause was the failure of police control, as too many people were let into the stadium. A 2012 reinvestigation concluded that crowd safety was compromised at every level by lack of police control.
Crush as millions flocked to the coffin of Ayatollah Khomeini as it was being moved through downtown Tehran, forcing the military to transport the body to Behesht-e Zahra cemetery using a helicopter.

Event: 1990 Mecca tunnel tragedy - Mina, Mecca, Saudi Arabia
Event description: A blockage at an exit of a pedestrian tunnel (Al-Ma'aisim tunnel) leading out from Mecca towards Mina and the Plains of Arafat led to deaths by suffocation of many religious pilgrims while they were traveling to perform the Stoning of the Devil ritual during the Hajj.

Event: Orkney Stadium Disaster - Orkney, North West, South Africa
Event description: Crush at a football match between Kaizer Chiefs and Orlando Pirates attended by about 30,000 fans in a stadium with a capacity for 23,000. When brawls broke out, people panicked, and trying to escape, were crushed against riot-control fences in the melee.

Event: Unnamed - Chalma sanctuary, Mexico State, Mexico
Event description: An additional 55 religious pilgrims were injured after being overwhelmed by a crowd trying to enter the atrium of the sanctuary church to receive the divine signal from the ashes. The crowd pushed on for access to the atrium, with most of the dead and injured being trampled.

Event: 1991 Taiyuan Illumination show crush [zh] - Jikong Bridge, Taiyuan, Shanxi Province, China
Event description: Large crowds of unknown size arrived in Yingze Park to see lanterns at a light festival. Crowds moving in opposite directions were crossing a poorly lit bridge. Some fell into the water and were drowned; others were killed in the crowd collapse and crush on the west side of the bridge. In all, 105 people were killed and 108 more were injured.

Event: City College stampede - New York City, United States
Event description: At an oversold charity basketball game featuring rap stars, 29 others were injured while entering an overcrowded gymnasium while funneling through a small stairwell area at the City College of New York.

Event: Lan Kwai Fong Tragedy - Lan Kwai Fong, Hong Kong
Event description: 67 others injured as a crowd of 15,000 to 20,000 revelers celebrated New Year's Eve in the city's nightclub district, controlled by 118 police officers. The victims were mostly teenagers and people in their 20s. The Independent reported witnesses as saying it was impossible to distinguish between the yelps of the partying crowd and the victims' agonized screams.

Event: 1994 Hajj stampede - Jamarat Bridge, Mecca, Saudi Arabia
Event description: Hajj pilgrims were killed and injured during a crowd crush at the Stoning of the Devil ritual.

Gowari people in a political protest, mostly women and children, perished in a crush triggered by cane-wielding police who attempted to prevent the estimated crowd of 40,000 from pressing towards the Vidan Bhavan. 500 others were injured.

Event: Ozone Disco fire - Quezon City, Philippines
Event description: A fire at a nightclub filled beyond capacity led to a crush at the only exit, whose doors opened inward. Many of the bodies were discovered along the corridor leading to the exit, piled up waist-high.

147 others were injured on the steep stairway of Estadio Mateo Flores prior to a World Cup qualifying match between Guatemala and Costa Rica. The crowd was estimated at 50,000 in the stadium designed to seat 37,500.
Hajj pilgrims were trampled to death, 180 more injured in an incident on the Jamarat Bridge.

Event: 1999 Sabarimala stampede - Sabarimala shrine, Kerala, India
Event description: When a landslide caused a cave-in during a Hindu pilgrimage on the day of Makara Jyothi, panic ensued and 200,000 male devotees panicked as the hill upon which they stood collapsed into the temple. The BBC reported that "Some of the dead were buried in the collapse, but most died in a stampede to avoid the landslide."

A sudden thunderstorm caused a number of young people to race for nearby shelter during an open-air concert. The crowd was funneled toward the underpass of the Nyamiha metro station and many were killed when they started slipping on the wet pavement, falling and trampling each other.

"Severe crowd accumulation" at one exit of Bergisel Stadium went unnoticed. Darkness, a steep slope and a slippery surface were contributing factors, but "panic did not occur at any time." Four others were left in a vegetative state, and 38 were injured.

Event: Throb nightclub disaster - Chatsworth, KwaZulu-Natal, South Africa
Event description: Children killed and 100 injured after a panic that broke out after a teargas canister detonated during a party for 600 children.
Occurred as the crowd rushed the stage. Another 26 people were injured, 3 of them seriously.
Spectators at a World Cup qualifier between Zimbabwe and South Africa died trying to leave the National Sports Stadium after police fired tear gas to control the crowd.
Hajj pilgrims trampled in a crowd crush during the Stoning of the Devil ritual.

Event: Ellis Park Stadium disaster - Johannesburg, South Africa
Event description: Crush during a football match between Kaizer Chiefs and Orlando Pirates

Event: Accra Sports Stadium disaster - Accra, Ghana
Event description: Crush at a football match between Kumasi Asante Kotoko and Accra Hearts of Oak after police fired tear gas at rioters.
247 others injured by a crowd crush after a fireworks show.
Children aged 10 to 14 killed on the stairway leading to the entrance of a discothèque.
Occurred during the Stoning of the Devil ritual of the Hajj pilgrimage.

Event: 2003 E2 nightclub stampede - Chicago, United States
Event description: Crush in the stairway exit to the nightclub, after a pepper spray was used on an upper-story dance floor.

Event: The Station nightclub fire - West Warwick, Rhode Island, United States
Event description: Many of the victims trampled.
Occurred at Jamarat Bridge during the Stoning of the Devil ritual of the Hajj.

Event: 2004 Miyun stampede - Miyun County, Beijing, China
Event description: 15 others injured in a crowd crush during Lantern Festival in Mihong Park.
Women were killed in a crush after people rushed to collect free sarees.

Event: Mandher Devi temple stampede - Maharashtra, India
Event description: Hindu pilgrims surged near Mandhradevi temple.
Crush after Iran-Japan match (2006 FIFA World Cup qualification) when leaving Azadi Stadium.
Rumors among Shiite pilgrims of a suicide bomber led to mass panic and a crush on the bridge, killing many before it finally collapsed.
Crush as flood relief supplies were handed out to homeless refugees.
Occurred at Jamarat Bridge during the Stoning of the Devil ritual of the Hajj.

Event: PhilSports Arena Stampede - Pasig, Metro Manila, Philippines
Event description: Crush at the venue of the first anniversary celebrations of ABS-CBN's variety show Wowowee.
More than 200 others injured in a crush at a campaign rally.
Crush at the end of a football game between Zambia and Republic of Congo.
Women were crushed to death at a train station.
Crush after a crowd of 15,000 watched a public execution in a stadium, 34 others injured.
Crush at the launching album concert of the metal band Beside.

Event: Unnamed - Ashok Nagar, Madhya Pradesh, India
Event description: More than a dozen others injured at a temple crush during a pilgrimage.

Event: New's Divine nightclub tragedy - Mexico City, Mexico
Event description: 13 others injured at a nightclub crush during a police raid.

Event: Naina Devi stampede - Himachal Pradesh, India
Event description: 47 others injured in a stampede at the Naina Devi temple after a rain shelter collapsed, which worshipers mistakenly took to be a landslide.

Event: Unnamed - Butembo, Democratic Republic of Congo
Event description: Rumors of players using witchcraft led to rioting at a football match which was dispersed by police using tear gas, causing the crush.

425 others injured at the Chamunda Devi temple in a panic caused by a rumor that a bomb was planted in the temple complex. Local authorities, however, blamed steep, slippery slopes leading to the temple.
Children died in a crush in an overcrowded children's dance hall.
Crush at a discotheque. 3 of the dead were schoolgirls. 8 people were injured.

Event: Houphouët-Boigny Arena stampede - Abidjan, Côte d'Ivoire
Event description: 130 others injured as fans tried to squeeze into the stadium for a World Cup qualifier between Côte d'Ivoire and Malawi.

7 boys and one girl aged between 11 and 14 years old were killed and 26 injured in result of a crush in Yucai Middle School. 52 evening classes were dismissed at the same time, and the crush occurred when most of the students tried to exit down the same stairwell. It was raining outside, and that particular stairwell was closest to the dormitories.

Event: Pratapgarh stampede - Kunda Pratapgarh, Uttar Pradesh, India
Event description: Over 200 others injured at Ram Janki Temple in a crush after the gates of the temple collapsed.
More than 500 others injured during crowd turbulences.

Event: Phnom Penh stampede - Phnom Penh, Cambodia
Event description: Crowd crush during a water festival near the Royal Palace.
100 others injured by a crowd crush near Sabarimala temple.
Crush after a PDP political rally after guards did not open a larger gate, and shot into the air to try to disperse the crowds.
Crush during a religious ceremony on the banks of the Ganges river.

Event: Port Said Stadium riot - Port Said, Egypt
Event description: In the Port Said Stadium, Al Masry fans attacked Al-Ahly fans during an Egyptian Premier League football match, caused a crush that left 200 others injured.

Crush occurred during Chhath Puja at the Adalat Ganj area ghat. At least 20 more were also injured, several critically. While it was originally believed that a collapsed bamboo bridge was the cause, later investigations determined that electricity being cut to the ghat was what led to panic.
26 children among those killed, and more than 200 injured at the Stade Félix Houphouët-Boigny during a New Year's fireworks celebration.
120 others injured as they tried to enter the overcrowded Estádio da Cidadela for a New Year's Eve vigil.

Event: Kiss nightclub fire - Santa Maria, Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil
Event description: 168 others injured as a result of a nightclub fire. According to local authorities the fire began on stage after members of the band flared a pyrotechnic device that ignited flammable acoustic foam in the ceiling. Other reasons for the high death toll included the lack of emergency exits and the excessive number of people present.
During the Hindu festival of Kumbh Mela, a crowd crush at the train station injured 39 others.
Spectators died escaping the Kota Lama Sport Stadium when a riot broke out after a boxing match.

Event: 2013 Madhya Pradesh stampede - Datia district, Madhya Pradesh, India
Event description: During the Hindu festival Navratri, a crush near the Ratangarh Mata Temple injured more than 100 others.
Shortly after a vigil at the Holy Ghost Adoration Center, 200 others injured in a crush on one of the narrow roads leading out of the town, though the center was over capacity.
Crush at the Beida Mosque due to mismanagement of crowds at the commemoration of a late religious figure.
At least 40 more were injured, when crowds coming to mourn Muslim spiritual leader Syedna Mohammed Burhanuddin became trapped against a gate at his residence.

Event: 2014 Nigeria Immigration Service recruitment tragedy - Various, Nigeria
Event description: Up to 24 recruits were killed and more than 119 were injured at several stadiums and other venues across Nigeria when 520,000 applicants were invited to take the aptitude test and physical exercises in order to get one of 4,556 available positions with the Nigerian Immigration Service. As many as one million might have shown up for the event at one of its 37 sites. In many cases, security forces fired their rifles into the air for crowd control, which triggered deadly panics. In at least one location the release of teargas had the same effect. In several locations there was no effective queuing, and all candidates had to enter the stadium through a single door.

Event: Unnamed - Kikwit, Democratic Republic of Congo
Event description: During a memorial concert for singer King Kester Emeneya, power was lost to the stadium and a crush formed at the exit.

Event: 2014 Stade Tata Raphaël disaster - Kinshasa, Democratic Republic of Congo
Event description: Crush at a football match between TP Mazembe and Vita Club when police fired a tear gas canister in order to control the crowds.
Crush at the end of a rap concert after the attendees tried to leave the venue through a small gate.
26 others injured in a crowd crush shortly after the Dussehra celebrations at the Gandhi Maidan.

Event: 2014 Multan stampede - Multan District, Punjab, Pakistan
Event description: 40 others injured as a result of a crush at Ibn-e-Qasim Bagh Stadium after a speech of Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf party chairman, Imran Khan. The latter alleged that only two gates of the venue were opened at the end of the rally and the lights were also switched off, but this was later denied by the DCO and local authorities.
40 others injured in a crush during a religious service.
42 others injured in a crush during New Year's celebrations at The Bund.
Crush at a football game between Zamalek and ENPPI.
Crush during the Shrove Tuesday festival after a man was electrocuted by high-voltage wires.
50 others injured following a crush at a free clothing drive.

Event: Unnamed - Godavari River, Andhra Pradesh, India
Event description: Pilgrims died in a crush on the banks of the Godavari River. The Hindu pilgrims had gathered to take a dip in the river at the start of the Maha Pushkaralu festival.
At least 50 more injured when people rushing the queue crushed those who fell and were asleep at the Baidyanath Temple.
Overcrowding incident during the Hajj pilgrimage. A further 934 were injured.
Girls aged ten to fifteen were killed and another 42 were injured in a crush on a stairway while trying to escape the school during the 2015 Hindu Kush earthquake.

Occurred during the annual thanksgiving festival of the Oromo people after police confronted protesters during the 2016 Ethiopian protests, resulting in a crush. The opposition political party Oromo Federalist Congress, claimed the number of people confirmed dead was 678. While the government claimed only tear gas and rubber bullets were fired by security forces on the ground as well as from the helicopter, eyewitness as well as some videos allegedly from the scene show security forces firing what seemed to be live rounds of ammunition.

Occurred near the Rajghat Bridge when many times the expected number of people were heading towards a religious retreat, causing a crush, and later a stampede due to rumors that the bridge had collapsed.

Event: Unnamed - Sagar Island, West Bengal, India
Event description: Occurred while pilgrims were trying to board vessels to Kolkata ahead of high tide, after a religious festival on the island.

At least 61 others injured, during a crush in the Estádio 4 de Janeiro ahead of the opening match of the Angolan football season while trying to enter the stadium before a match between Santa Rita de Cássia FC and Recreativo do Libolo.
28 others injured during a crush over food aid from a church group.

Event: Resorts World Manila attack - Pasay, Metro Manila, Philippines
Event description: Crush during the evacuation of the Resorts World Manila complex after a gunman opened fire and burned casino gambling equipment.

7 of the dead were children. At least 40 others injured during a crush at the Bingu National Stadium during the nation's independence day celebrations while trying to enter before a match between Nyasa Big Bullets and Silver Strikers F.C.
60 more injured in a crush when a wall collapsed at Demba Diop stadium as police fired tear gas at both sets of fans after a Senegalese League Cup final game between US Ouakam and Stade de Mbour.
Hundreds more injured in a crush following heavy rains in a footbridge between Parel and Elphinstone road stations.
15 women were killed and 40 women injured after breaking down barriers during a food-aid distribution.
At least 50 more injured during a funeral ritual for former mayor A.B.M. Mohiuddin Chowdhury when people tried to rush down a sloped gateway into the Rima Community Center.
A further 50 were injured in a crush while collecting alms before Ramadan.
Stampede after a tear gas canister was detonated in a crowded club.
Dozens more injured in a crush as concertgoers tried to leave the packed Lanterna Azzurra club after pepper spray was fired inside.

101 more injured in a crush before a concert on the country's 59th Independence Day at the Mahamasina Municipal Stadium. The show was about to start and people believed they could enter the stadium and began to push, but the police left the doors closed.
Pilgrims killed and at least 100 others injured in a crush near a major Shiite shrine while marking Ashura.
Crush at a funk music party at Paraisópolis, São Paulo after police entered the venue in pursuit of suspects, causing panic.

Event: Qasem Soleimani funeral stampede - Kerman, Iran
Event description: 200 more injured in a crush at the funeral of general Qasem Soleimani.
16 more injured in crush at a church when more than 4,500 attendees were being ushered through an exit so that they could walk on "anointed oil" during a prayer meeting

Event: Kakamega Primary School stampede - Kakamega, Kenya
Event description: Pupils killed in a staircase crush when they were leaving for the day.
Crush while relief aid was being distributed, mostly to refugees from Nigeria.
6 others injured in the Los Olivos District, when the police raided the Thomas Restobar nightclub to break up an illegal gathering amid the COVID-19 pandemic.

At least 15 killed (11 women) and many more injured in a crowd crush at a stadium, after thousands of people gathered to apply for permits to Pakistan when visa applications resumed after a seven-month pause due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

Event: 2021 Dar es Salaam stampede - Dar es Salaam, Tanzania
Event description: Crush at Uhuru Stadium at the wake of President John Magufuli.

Dozens more critically wounded in a crush at the annual Meron pilgrimage during Lag BaOmer. Organizers estimated that 100,000 people, the vast majority of whom were Ultra-Orthodox Jews, arrived on the night of 29 April.

Event: Astroworld Festival crowd crush - Houston, United States
Event description: Numerous others injured in a crowd surge at the Astroworld Festival hosted by rapper Travis Scott at NRG Park. 300 people were treated for injuries, and 11 people suffered cardiac arrest.

Event: Vaishno Devi Temple stampede - Jammu and Kashmir, India
Event description: 16 more injured during a crush at a Hindu shrine, triggered by a heavy rush of people coming to celebrate the New Year.
Crush at Olembe Stadium to watch a 2021 Africa Cup of Nations football match between Cameroon and Comoros.

Event: Port Harcourt stampede - Port Harcourt, Nigeria
Event description: Crush at a charity event at Port Harcourt Polo Club organised by Kings Assembly Pentecostal Church. Hundreds of people who had arrived hoping to receive free food and clothing broke through a fence, causing a panic.
A fire at the Abu Sefein Church caused panic and a crowd crush.

Event: Kanjuruhan Stadium disaster - Malang, East Java, Indonesia
Event description: Football fans were killed while fleeing from tear gas fired inside the stadium after a Super East Java Derby between Arema FC versus Persebaya Surabaya ended in a riot.

Event: Seoul Halloween crowd crush - Seoul, South Korea
Event description: Crush at a narrow alley in the Itaewon district during Halloween celebrations; at least 172 more people were injured. In December 2022, the death of one survivor from suicide was ruled by authorities to have been caused by the disaster, legally declaring him the 159th victim.

Event: Unnamed - Kinshasa, Democratic Republic of Congo
Event description: Crush at a concert headlined by music star Fally Ipupa at the Martyrs' Stadium
Crush at a political rally as crowds gathered to hear a speech by former Chief Minister N. Chandrababu Naidu.

Event: Freedom City mall crush - Kampala, Uganda
Event description: Crowds rushing to see a New Year's firework display got stuck in a narrow corridor in a shopping mall.

Armed Houthis fired into the air in an attempt at crowd control during a Ramadan charity distribution event and hit an electrical wire, which exploded and caused panic among those waiting. More than 300 others were injured.

Event: San Salvador crowd crush - San Salvador, El Salvador
Event description: During a Primera División football match between Alianza F.C. and C.D. FAS, fans tried to enter Estadio Cuscatlán after the gates had been closed, leading to a crush after they overran the barricades. More than 500 others were injured.
